FRAUDS.Definition: crimes of gaining money by using tricks or lies

FRAUD.Definition: a crime of gaining money by using tricks or lies

ON MERIT.Definition: due to her own qualities and skills

TIME-CONSUMING.Definition: taking a lot of time to do

SYRINGE.Definition: a hollow tube with a thin piece of metal attached, used for pushing some liquid into something

VEIN.Definition: a body tube that carries blood to the heart

SAMPLE.Definition: a small amount of something that shows what the whole is like

DROPPED OUT.Definition: gave up a course of study

DEVICE.Definition: a machine that has been invented for a particular purpose

STORYTELLER.Definition: a person who writes or tells stories

NEEDLES.Definition: a thin piece of metal with a point at one end

NORM.Definition: accepted standard, normal thing to except

PROTOTYPE.Definition: the first example or appearance of a machine or device

SECRETIVE.Definition: keeping secrets and not sharing information

FINGERPRINT.Definition: the mark on the end of a finger that is different in every person

PARANOIA.Definition: an unreasonable feeling that other people are going to harm you

ON THE CUSP OF.Definition: at the point when something is about to change

PARANOID.Definition: feeling nervous and worried because she believed other people were going to harm her

RELIABLY.Definition: in a good and trustworthy way

UNRELIABLE.Definition: not able to be relied on or trusted

CAPTIVATED.Definition: attracted by her character and charm

TESTIFY.Definition: give information about something in a court of law

CERTIFIED.Definition: officially recognised as having certain qualifications

PERSONNEL.Definition: the people who work in a organisation

SECRECY.Definition: the state of something being kept secret

NON-DISCLOSURE-AGREEMENT.Definition: a contract by which the employees were not allowed to share any information related to the company

SELF-MADE.Definition: rich and successful as a result of her own actions and skills

ENTREPRENEURSHIP.Definition: the activity of setting up a business

REDESIGNED.Definition: designed in a new different way

VISIONARY.Definition: having strong and original ideas about how to improve the future

SUSPICIOUS.Definition: feeling that something illegal was happening

DILIGENT.Definition: careful and using a lot of effort

THREATENED.Definition: warned that they would take action against him

HOUSE OF CARDS.Definition: a house built out of playing cards, used here to show the particular insecure situation

PEER REVIEWED.Definition: evaluated by experts in the field

MISLEADING.Definition: causing them to have a wrong impression about the situation

SCEPTICS.Definition: people who question or doubt accepted opinions

SUGGESTED.Definition: mentioned an idea for other people to consider

AFTERMATH.Definition: the period after an unpleasant event

CHARISMA.Definition: the quality of being attractive and inspiring

DRIVEN.Definition: very hard working and ambitious towards a goal

DETERMINED.Definition: wanting to succeed very much and having decided to do everything in order to achieve it

CONVINCING.Definition: able to make you believe that it was true

OUT OF HER DEPTH.Definition: in a situation beyond her capabilities

SCANDAL.Definition: a morally wrong action that causes public disapproval
